name: PayChannel
comment: Lists the supported  bill payment channels. Each Billing Arrangement (BAR) can have one or more pay channels.A pay channel can either be postpaid or prepaid. A prepaid pay channel represents a bucket or a balance, while a postpaid pay channel represents a payment method for paying a bill or invoice.
vf short description: Lists the supported  bill payment channels. Each Billing Arrangement (BAR) can have one or more pay channels.A pay channel can either be postpaid or prepaid.

fields.name: PayChannelSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: ValidFromDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity begin in EDWH

fields.name: ValidUntilDate
fields.comment: BI field which represents record validity end in EDWH

fields.name: KeyTypeId
fields.comment: Key type of record

fields.name: PayChannelKey
fields.comment: Indicates a unique identifier for a pay channel record (PK). Generated Key based on Pay Channel Id

fields.name: PayChannelDesc
fields.comment: Describes the pay channel that is to be used for selecting the pay channel or bill display. PaymentMethod.description

fields.name: CustomerSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BillingArrangementSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PaymentTypeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PayChannelStatusSK
fields.comment: BI field: AI surrogate key

fields.name: PayChannelConvergedStatusSK
fields.comment: BI field: AI surrogate key for converged attribute

fields.name: OpenDate
fields.comment: Date on which a pay channel was opened. PaymentMethod.validFor.startDateTime

fields.name: StatusDate
fields.comment: Indicates the logical date when the current channel status changed. PaymentMethod.statusDate

fields.name: PayChannelConvergedStatusDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date when the converged status changed.

fields.name: RecurringFrequencyTimeValue
fields.comment: Defines the time interval for each recurring payment frequency. The expected values for each frequency are: - For daily - The number of days between payments. This attribute is relevant mainly for prepaid channels. - For weekly - The day in the week (1-7). For example, Monday, Tuesday, and so on.- For monthly - The date of the month (1-28). This attribute is mandatory when the Recurring Frequency is in use. The default value is 1. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: RecurringPaymentAmount
fields.comment: Indicates the recurring payment fixed amount that is, the recharge amount. This is relevant for prepaid pay channels and is mandatory when a recurring method is used. //Customized per implementation

fields.name: IssueDate
fields.comment: Issue date of the recurring charge. This attribute is relevant for prepaid pay channels when a recurring payment method is used. The date mask is YYYYMMDDHH24MISS. For example:19600101000000 - HISTORICAL-DATETIME 47001231000000 - FUTURE-DATETIME //Customized per implementation

fields.name: CreditCardTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the credit card type. This field is relevant for the credit card payment method. This can be relevant both for prepaid and postpaid pay channels.Example values are:M - MasterCardV - VisaA - American Express PaymentMethod.details.type

fields.name: RecurringFrequencyInd
fields.comment: Indicates the frequency of the recurring payment. This attribute, along with the Recurring Frequency Value, RECURR_FREQ_VAL, defined the interval between payments. When empty, the value of this attribute is N/A or the default frequency of the bill cycle (usually monthly). This attribute is relevant mainly for prepaid channels. For example, the values for CSPYMRCFRQ with layer 0 are: D - DAILY M - MONTHLY W - WEEKLY //Customized per implementation

fields.name: PayChannelId
fields.comment: Unique identifier for the pay channels in the source system. PaymentMethod.id

fields.name: BssCreationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was created in the source system PaymentMethod.createdOn

fields.name: BssModificationDate
fields.comment: Indicates the date on which a record was modified in the source system PaymentMethod.lastModifiedOn

fields.name: ModificationEmployeeSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: BankAccountNum
fields.comment: Bank account number for direct debit transactions. PaymentMethod.details.accountNumber

fields.name: BankAccountTypeInd
fields.comment: Indicates the type of bank account. This indicator is relevant when using Direct Debit from a Bank Account payment method. PaymentMethod.details.accountNumberType

fields.name: BankBranchCode
fields.comment: Indicates the bank branch number where the customer s account is managed. PaymentMethod.details.bic.

fields.name: BankCode
fields.comment: Indicates the code of the bank where the customers account is managed. This field is relevant for the Direct Debit from Bank Account payment method. PaymentMethod.details.bank

fields.name: BankName
fields.comment: Bank name for direct debit. PaymentMethod.details.bank

fields.name: CreditCardNum
fields.comment: Indicates the credit card number. This field is relevant for the credit card payment method. Implementation may mask this value for privacy reasons. PaymentMethod.details.cardNumber //Customization Instruction: validate during implementation

fields.name: CreditCardExpiryDate
fields.comment: Indicates the credit card expiration date. This field is relevant for the credit card payment method. PaymentMethod.details.expirationDate

fields.name: ExternalId
fields.comment: An external identifier of the account. This attribute is used if the corresponding pay channel is also present in the external system.

fields.name: FinancialAccountSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PaymentOwnerDesc
fields.comment: Indicates the name and address of the person holding the credit card or bank account. The name and address in free text is relevant for postpaid pay channels, but can also be used for prepaid pay channels. PaymentMethod.relatedParty.name where PaymentMethod.relatedParty.role = "Customer" and PaymentMethod.relatedParty.type = "Customer"

fields.name: CreditCardInstitutionName
fields.comment: Name of the financial institution owning the credit card. PaymentMethod.details.issuer

fields.name: PaymentMethodCode
fields.comment: Indicates the Payment method. The values are:AP - ATM CA - CASH CC - CREDIT_CARD CQ - CHEQUE DD - DIRECT_DEBIT PaymentMethod.type

fields.name: PaymentMethodSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: PayChannelName
fields.comment: Name assigned to the payment channel PaymentMethod.name

fields.name: PreferredFlag
fields.comment: Indicates whether or not the payment channel is preferred by the owner. PaymentMethod.preferred

fields.name: AuthorizationCode
fields.comment: Authorization code provided by a financial institution. Typically this would be populated for recurring payments using the payment method, as payments have an authorization code of their own. PaymentMethod.authorizationCode

fields.name: EndDate
fields.comment: The end of pay channel validity. PaymentMethod.validFor.endDateTime

fields.name: ContactSK
fields.comment: Surrogate key of the object

fields.name: SourceSystemId
fields.comment: Represents the code of the source system that the leading entity of the current target is coming from. It is suffix also include the code of the DB instance on that system such that in case of multiple instances of the same source system are deployed (Scalability) it will be possible to trace the target to it is source system instance

fields.name: DeleteIndicator
fields.comment: Set to True when the leading source entity of this target entity was deleted in the source system

fields.name: RowUpdateTime
fields.comment: The time stamp when the row was written to the Target real-time/staging storage

fields.name: SourceUpdateTime
fields.comment: The latest create/update timestamp of any of the entities composing this target entity

fields.name: SourceQueryTime
fields.comment: The timestamp of reading the data from source system. - when using CDC it is usually similar to the latest update, in SQL cases it is the time of running the SQL. When a dummy target entity is created as a temporary entity to maintain referential integrity this indicator will be set to True. As soon as the real target entity is stored it will be stored with False dummy indicator value.

fields.name: DptiId
fields.comment: Counter which represents the cycle number of the job	is_deleted	boolean	is_deleted	Represents if the record is deleted. Is been updated after the compaction job

fields.name: PTime
fields.comment: Partition time based on the event time for target entities marked to be partitioned event time rounded the correct partition window (hourly, daily etc..)

fields.name: Insert_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which inserted the record in the table

fields.name: Update_Load_Id
fields.comment: BI technical field for job id which updated the record in the table
